ignored.p: DbPlugin is a wrapper around DbUnit library and enables to set up and verify state of the database.
2. Configure and attach to ExamExtension the DbPlugin
There are commands for setting up and verifying database state. Also there is a command to just show current database state and generate dataset files based on it.

dd.p: Creates and applies DbUnit dataset for specified table

pre.code: <e:db-set table="person" cols="id=1..10, name, birthday, created={{now}}"> <e:row>Bob, {{date '01.01.2001' format='dd.MM.yyyy'}}</e:row> <e:row> Ed, {{date '02.02.2002' format='dd.MM.yyyy'}}</e:row> </e:db-set>

dd.p: Cleans specified tables with DELETE_ALL DbUnit operation
Creates DbUnit dataset and verifies that it matches specified database table

pre.code: <e:db-check table="person" cols="id=1..10, name, birthday, created={{now}}"> <e:row>Bob, {{date '01.01.2001' format='dd.MM.yyyy'}}</e:row> <e:row> Ed, {{date '02.02.2002' format='dd.MM.yyyy'}}</e:row> </e:db-check>

dd.p: Verifies that database matches state described in DbUnit datasets
Creates DbUnit dataset files and prints content of specified database table
